* Strong proficiency in Angular and Typescript.
* Experience working with tools, such as Docker, K8s, Terraform, Git, Jenkins
* Experienced working in GCP and/or AWS cloud environments


**Compensation**
* Salary range: 700,000–750,000 SEK per year depending on experience and qualifications
* Bonus Plan: 19% bonus target
* Benefits and Perks vary based on location.


**Benefits And Perks**
* Regional specific competitive benefits
* Build your own Benefits (BYOB) perk
* Many other fun and exciting benefits and activities!


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Coalsese Management Consulting is seeking a skilled and experienced
 **Embedded Software Engineer** 
 to join our team in the automotive domain. Your mission will be to help bring a Chinese-sourced Battery Management System (BMS) up to European safety and software standards, ensuring compliance with EU regulations and alignment with industry best practices, including ISO 26262. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of cutting-edge battery technology and high automotive safety standards, contributing to the electrification revolution.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Analyze the existing BMS software and identify gaps related to EU safety and software standards.
* Redesign or modify software components to meet ISO 26262 and other relevant standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware, systems, and safety engineers, to ensure an integrated approach.
* Develop and implement embedded software for real-time battery management, focusing on safety-critical applications.
* Conduct software validation and verification, including unit testing, integration testing, and system-level testing.
* Create and maintain technical documentation, such as software architecture, requirements, and traceability matrices.
* Support compliance and certification activities, including preparing for audits or safety assessments.
* Act as a technical liaison between the Chinese supplier and internal/external stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and alignment.



  





**Required Skills and Experience:** 



* **5+ years** 
 of experience in embedded software development, preferably in the automotive industry.
* Expertise in
 **real-time systems** 
 and programming languages like
 **C/C++** 
 .
* Proven knowledge of
 **battery management systems (BMS)** 
 or other power electronics.
* Familiarity with
 **ISO 26262** 
 and other safety standards relevant to automotive systems.
* Hands-on experience with communication protocols such as
 **CAN, LIN, UART** 
 , or similar.
* Strong debugging, testing, and troubleshooting skills for embedded systems.
* Experience working with cross-functional, multicultural teams.



  





 You would be able to operate as an independent consultant for this assignment, which I can support with.
 **You will need your own AB company or at least be able to set one up, if you cannot do this we politely ask you do not apply for this role in order to save all parties involved time.** 
 If you are not available for a new project now, we offer a generous referral scheme. If this assignment is of interest to you. To speed up your application, when replying please provide an up-to-date copy of your CV along with your contact information.
 



  





**Get in touch:** 




  





 Learn more about Coalesce Management Consulting, our projects, and the support we provide to our consultants at https://expertisedelivered.com
 



  





 No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

title: Software Engineer - Python - Container Images
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open-source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long-term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be developing the tools and technology for building and maintaining this new generation of container images. You'll be working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure we deliver container images with the highest quality whilst maintaining a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based DevOps.
   

  

 You will be contributing to fast-moving products like Rocks (OCI images) and Chisel, and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this new team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and participate in exciting and exploratory tasks, where your feedback will be critical for the decision-making process. As an engineer, your seniority will be based on your software development background and ability to lead junior team members.
   

  

 Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community!
   

  

* Location\*\*: EMEA


 This role entails
   

  

* Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
* Work on automated Ci/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
* Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
* Work in Python to deliver new functionalities to our container-building tools
* Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
* Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
* Engage with the open-source community as a subject-matter expert
* Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
* Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributed environment
* Mentor and help hiring
* Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
* You are a team player and have experience in collaborative development
* You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
* You have a track record of delivering timely, high-quality software
* You have experience with container images and containerised operations
* You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
* You have significant experience with Python
* You are experienced with Linux systems administration and package management
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills to convey technical concepts
* You bring clarity to technical and engineering discussions
* You are someone who strongly believes that sharing is caring, and knowledge is power
* Your skills range from those of a Graduate to a mid-senior Software Engineer
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or a similar degree


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: International Business Developer Nordics
description:
Are you skilled at building strong client relationships and excited to further expand Greener’s battery rental solutions into Northern Europe? Do you live in Sweden or Denmark and do you have commercial experience in these markets? Join us as International Business Developer Nordics at Greener!
   

  

**Who are we?**
 We are Greener Power Solutions. We are on a mission to make the temporary energy market emission-free with our mobile batteries. We can deploy these anywhere to store and deliver energy. It's an important mission, where we could really use your help.
   

  

**Powering up international partnerships**
 As part of Greener’s Sales team, you’ll take the lead in expanding our presence across the Nordic markets, developing strong partnerships and renting and selling batteries to clients across Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and Finland. While collaborating with a committed team, your role will focus on establishing our presence and making sustainable energy solutions available to new clients in new areas across different industries. You will do this independently throughout your region, so travelling is also part of your day-to-day work as well as being your own entrepreneur and setting up your own Greener network.
   

  

 As our
 **International Business Developer Nordics** 
 , you’ll lead efforts to grow Greener’s reach across your region of focus, concentrating on partnerships with rehiring parties (like diesel generator rental companies) who can bring our sustainable solutions to end clients. Your day might involve connecting with potential partners, coordinating with operations to ensure deployments run smoothly, strategizing new ways to engage and inspire partners and reaching out and setting appointments with potential partners or end clients.
   

  

 With each conversation, you’ll bring a proactive and solution-oriented mindset to expand our network across the Nordic markets - We get things done.
   

  

**Why go Greener?**
 Besides contributing to a greener world, here's what you'll get (subject to your location of residence):
   

  

* Exciting and important work in a rapidly growing scale-up;
* An inspiring work environment with a committed, friendly team and an open and honest work culture;
* 25 vacation days per year based on a full-time employment (subject to location);
* Pension and mobility plan;
* A bonus plan;
* A laptop of your choice (Microsoft or MacOS);
* Budget for setting up your home workspace.


**Who are you?**
* A true Greener – you want to make the world a bit better, you question the status quo, and you're always looking for ways to innovate and improve
* Sales and partnership expertise: 8-10 years of experience in a similar B2B client-facing role, ideally with a focus on B2B partnerships and building relationships from scratch.
* Industry experience: Previous experience in the (energy) rental industry
* Market insight: Knowledge of the Nordic markets, with experience building networks across multiple countries
* Communication skills: Fluent in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills. Fluency in another language such as Swedish or Danish is a big plus.
* Client-centred approach: A passion for building long-lasting client relationships and delivering outstanding service
* Location of residence: you live (and are able to work) in either Denmark OR Sweden.


 At Greener, we're not only committed to a greener world, but also to a fair, inclusive, and diverse work environment. We believe that different perspectives and experiences are the foundation for creating innovative and sustainable solutions. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.
   

  

 Do you see yourself as our
 **International Business Developer?** 
 Then apply directly with your English CV and a brief motivation, and our hiring team will get in touch with you within 5 working days!
   

  

 Note for candidates: please be aware that we will not be taking applicants who do not live in Denmark or Sweden into consideration. While this is a remote role, we require our Business Developer to be present in one of the aforementioned countries in order to visit clients there, and to be eligible to work there without requiring a visa sponsorship.
   

  

 Note for recruitment agencies: we appreciate the effort but we are not looking to collaborate with you at this stage. Candidate proposals will
 **not** 
 be taken into consideration.

title: (Senior) Software Quality Assurance Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Integration Division (INT), Integration Solutions Unit (ISU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Software Quality Assurance Engineer\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark: (Senior) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


***Panel interviews are anticipated for August 2024***
 Purpose
   

  

 We are looking for someone with a strong background in software testing methodologies, encompassing manual, automated, performance, and regression testing, combined with a deep understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC). If you're interested in defining test strategies, coordinating test activities and leading a team of test engineers in ensuring the delivery of high-quality software integration solutions, this position is perfect for you! Hands-on experience in writing manual or automated test cases for complex and long-term software products is essential for the role. Join our team and take your career to the next level.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report directly to the Head of Unit and will work in close contact with platform leads and with the other colleagues across the department.
   

  

 The Integration Solutions Unit focuses on designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining integration solutions that facilitate seamless communication and interaction between different software systems, applications, or components within the EIB Group.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Define test strategies and plans to ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Coordinate test activities and prioritize testing requirements.
* Assess the performance and scalability of the integration solutions under different conditions to identify bottlenecks or performance issues.
* Lead a team of test engineers and developers to execute testing activities effectively.
* Write manual or automated test cases to validate software functionality.
* Develop and implement automated testing frameworks and tools.
* Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous testing and early defect identification.
* Analyse test results and collaborate with development teams to address issues.
* Ensure adherence to software quality standards and best practices.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science, economics or related disciplines
* At least 5 years of relevant professional experience in manual and/or automated software testing
* Experience in testing of APIs including authentication/authorisation mechanisms (such as OAuth, SAML)
* Experience in using test management tools such as Jira, Xray, TestRail
* Experience with tools such as Postman, RESTAssured, SOAPUI, selenium, cypress, katalon, JMeter, LoadRunner, Mockito, WireMock, DBUnit, Jenkins, Azure DevOps
* Experience in writing and executing SQL queries for database testing
* Experience in working with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud as a nice to have
* Experience in writing and maintaining automated test scripts using testing frameworks and programming languages like Python or Java would be an asset.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt

title: Complex Visualization Architect  (Front End Engineer)
description:
We are urgently looking for a frontend developer to create a proof-of-concept for a revolutionary
 **visual programming environment that combines natural language with dynamic block composition** 
 - a system where
 **blocks intelligently adapt based on context and zoom level** 
 . This project initially focuses on trading strategies but with broader applications.
 **We need someone who can make complex systems feel intuitive without tutorials.** 




  





**Apply with portfolio and a few lines on your fit and motivation to ahmed@batonics.com** 




  





**Required** 



* an impressive portfolio
* a fast and strong coder



  





**Preferable** 
 :
 


* Sweden or EU based
* Beyond front-end/UX - fullstack-ish
* Familiarity with cursor, v0, replit, and other AI tools
* Experience in designing dynamic visualization systems that adapt to complexity like intelligent zoom
* Available immediately
* Experience with color theory, relationship highlighting, progressive disclosure in complex interfaces
* Experience in semantic zooming , contextual detail management, auto-grouping/coalescence of components
* Interest in joining long-term as a core team member



  





**Compensation** 
 : Hourly based for the first 3 months
 



  





**Interview and Assessment:** 
 We'll have a multi-hour assessment task as part of the selection process, if it'll be used in our work we'll pay upto 4,000 SEK for it.
 



  




* Batonics AB: We're building a system that democratizes complex data operations through intuitive visual programming - making institutional-grade tools accessible without sacrificing power. The interface you create will evolve into a platform that maintains its lightweight feel whether handling 3 blocks or 3000, requiring no tutorials while enabling powerful compositions. This could revolutionize how people interact with data and algorithms across multiple domains.

title: AI Tech Lead
description:
We are looking for a skilled Tech Lead to join us on our journey to scale up our in-house AI startup, working with cutting-edge generative AI tools and technologies to deliver transformative new products and services. We believe that generative AI offers a vast ocean of opportunities and value for the curious and innovative. Are you that person?
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our AI Tech Lead**
 You will be a Technical Lead in an agile, cross-functional team, working closely with the team lead to build applications and services utilizing generative AI while guiding the team in modern development practices across cloud, backend, and frontend development.
   

  

 We are an agile DevOps team, fully cloud-native, working with multiple cloud providers and developing applications using modern design patterns such as microservices. Reliability, security, and observability are core values, Developer Experience (DevEx) is important to us, and we actively explore the use of generative AI tools to support our development.
   

  

 We have already built and launched multiple generative AI products, leveraging LLMs, speech, vision, and embedding models, as well as RAG-based and other architectures, and we continuously explore new and emerging technologies.
   

  

 Additionally, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in bridging technology with business—interfacing with multiple stakeholders, business leaders, and product owners across the entire ASSA ABLOY organization. Your role will help them understand the potential of generative AI and support them in scoping AI-driven projects.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Lead and mentor the team with your deep technical expertise in cloud, backend, and frontend development
* Stay ahead of the curve by keeping up with the latest advancements in AI technologies


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has extensive experience designing both application and cloud architectures (Azure or AWS).
* Develops and maintains scalable microservices and APIs.
* Builds secure, high-performance, and reliable solutions.
* Collaborates with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions effectively.
* Brings hands-on expertise in DevOps and testing practices.
* Has a solid track record of developing full-stack applications in the cloud, with bonus points for experience with Python and React.
* Is skilled in leading and organizing DevOps teams in an agile environment.
* Has experience mentoring and supporting junior team members.
* Is fluent in both spoken and written English.
* Is curious about generative AI—ideally, you have already done development in this area or dedicated time to learning about it. Curiosity and interest in generative AI are highly valued.


**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes
* Hybrid model of working
* Flexible working hours
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait.**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Software Engineer - packaging - optimize Ubuntu Server
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical's Ubuntu Engineering Server Team is looking for open source enthusiasts to help build the distro of the future. The Server Team maintains and packages a wide variety of software including webservers, databases, and virtualization and containerization stacks. This is an exciting opportunity for you, a software engineer passionate about open source software. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and help us to bring free software to the widest audience.
   

  

 Ubuntu Server is a platform that enables amazing technology the whole world over, and is the #1 operating system in the public clouds. Applicants to this role will have the opportunity to help with everything that goes into evolving Ubuntu. You will get to work with our experienced team and have the benefits of learning and growing alongside the best engineers in the business.
   

  

**This role entails** 
  

  

* Collaborating proactively within a distributed team
* Fostering a software ecosystem with seamless user experience for all Ubuntu users
* Evaluating contributions of other engineers to maintain high-quality software standards.
* Playing a role in shaping the future of Ubuntu via both - new ideas in your areas of interest and advising on work being done elsewhere
* Collaborating with other teams in the Ubuntu and Debian communities, with upstream projects, and commercially supported customers
* Debugging issues on open source code and team maintained code.
* Working with the team to maintain Ubuntu Server packages, specifically but not limited to:
+ Traditional server workloads (web servers, databases, network services, etc)
+ Virtualisation and Containers
+ Package management and dependencies
+ Language runtimes and toolchains

* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


**What we are looking for in you**
* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* Interest or experience in open source maintenance or contribution
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree (or any higher)
* Understands basic reproducibility and testing steps. Comfortable setting up test systems in containers or virtual machines. Able to describe issues and steps clearly
* Strong fundamentals in one language from C/C++, Python, Rust, Go
* Interest in learning distro packaging
* Fundamental understanding of package management and dependency resolution.
* Interest in containerization and virtualization such as Docker or OCI service containers, LXD system containers, and local virtualization like Virtualbox or QEMU, or Public Clouds


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Tech Lead, Engineering
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions team! You will be responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of technology projects and the continuous improvement of technical processes within the organization. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Provide technical guidance and leadership to the development team, ensuring high-quality software design and architecture
* Oversee the technical aspects of project planning, including effort estimation, resource allocation, and timeline management.
* Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and with high quality.
* Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate GraphQL APIs with user interfaces.
* Implement and enforce coding standards, design patterns, and best practices
* Conduct code reviews and ensure the technical integrity of solutions
* Mentor and coach team members, fostering their professional growth and development
* Analyze and resolve complex technical issues in production environments.


**To excel in this role, you are expected to be:**
* A bachelor's or master's degree holder in computer science, business administration, or another relevant area.
* Experienced as a Full Stack Developer or in a similar role in IT and function/business/industry.
* Skilled and experienced in Microsoft Azure integration and data technology stack, as well as in API/Event-driven Microservices using ASP.Net Core, SQL, and NoSQL.
* Strongly proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Experienced with front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).
* Proficient in back-end development using Node.js and related frameworks (e.g., Express).
* Knowledge of Apollo GraphQL is a plus.
* Understanding of RESTful APIs and their differences from GraphQL.
* Maintaining role-based competence and training regularly.


 We are excited to hire individuals who are passionate about data platforms and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

 We offer a hybrid work model to support your productivity.
   

  

**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 19.03.2025 at the latest. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Durga Paineni by phone or via email at durga.paineni@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:** 



* Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
* Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
* Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
* Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
* Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
* Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
* Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Big Data Developer -  Scala Spark/ SparkSQL/Hadoop
description:
About LTIMindtree
 




  





 LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.
 



  





 Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale.
 



  





**Job Details -** 




  





 What we are looking for -
 **Primary Skillset - Scala/Spark Familiar DevOps pipeline concept** 




  





**Language** 
 - English
 



**Type of hiring** 
 - Full-Time Employment
 



**Working Location -** 
 Stockholm Sweden
 



**Working Model** 
 - 3 days a week from the office.
 



  





**"Key responsibilities** 




**• Develop Scala/Spark programs, scripts, and macros for data extraction, transformation and analysis** 




**• Design and implement solutions to meet business requirements** 




**• Support and maintain existing Hadoop applications and related technologies** 




**• Develop and maintain metadata, user access and security controls** 




**• Develop and maintain technical documentation, including data models, process flows and system diagrams** 




  





**Description of knowledge and experience** 




**• Minimum 3-5 years of experience from Scala/Spark related projects and/or engagements** 




**• Create Scala/Spark jobs for data transformation and aggregation as per the complex business requirements.** 




**• Should be able work in a challenging and agile environment with quick turnaround times and strict deadlines.** 




**• Perform Unit tests of the Scala code** 




**• Raise PR, trigger build and release JAR versions for deployment via Jenkins pipeline** 




**• Should be familiar with CI/CD concepts and the processes** 




**• Peer review the code** 




**• Perform RCA of the bugs raised** 




**• Should have excellent understanding of Hadoop ecosystem** 




**• Should be well versed with below technologies** 




**o Jenkins** 




**o HQL(Hive Queries)** 




**o Oozie** 




**o Shell scripting** 




**o GIT** 




**o Splunk** 




  





**Preferred** 




**• Relevant certifications (e.g., Scala, Spark, Hadoop, Performance)** 




**• Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Python, R)** 




**• Insight to cloud-based solutions such as Snowflake** 




**• Experience in Financial Services, preferable in the Credit risk domain"**

title: Maximo SME
description:
**About the job:** 




**Senior Maximo SME Technical Functional Application Developer (Remote, 12-24 Month Contract) PART-TIME/FULL-TIME** 




  





**Overview** 




  





 Belmont Lavan invites seasoned professionals to apply for the role of Senior Maximo SME Technical Functional Application Developer. This is a remote position on a contract basis for 12-24 months, open to candidates worldwide. The role is pivotal in our mission to enhance asset management capabilities through advanced Maximo solutions and can be engaged on a full-time or part-time basis.
 



  





**Role Overview & Strategic Contributions** 




  





**Strategic Value** 
 :
 



  





  




* Development and Configuration: Customize IBM Maximo solutions to meet business objectives, ensuring the system's alignment with operational goals
* Issue Resolution: Employ problem-solving skills to address and resolve challenges, aiding in a smooth transition during the upgrade process
* Documentation and Accuracy: Maintain rigorous documentation standards for recording precise changes and implementations
* Technical Functional Support: Provide expert support and guidance for Maximo applications
* Leadership in Stakeholder Engagement: Lead technical discussions with stakeholders, delivering best practice solutions in Maximo Asset Management
* Project Timeline Adherence: Guide the technical team to meet project milestones and schedules



  





**Required Expertise** 




  




* A minimum of 5 years as a technical functional resource in IBM Maximo Enterprise Asset Management Software
* Proficiency in IBM Maximo 7.x & or exposure to MAS 8 application configuration and support, including experience with the Maximo Integration Framework, Java, and BIRT and Cognos report writing
* Excellent communication skills, capable of engaging effectively in a multi-stakeholder environment



  





**Preferred Expertise** 




  




* Hands-on experience with MAS 8, complemented by Oracle PL/SQL development skills
* Certification as a Maximo Deployment Professional
* some experience Cloud Service Provider (IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure), with a strong preference for candidates with Oracle Database experience
* Over 5 years of experience in Enterprise Asset Management, particularly in Maximo upgrades, and business application requirement and design management



  





**Overall Team Impact** 




  





 The Senior Maximo SME will play a critical role in the successful upgrade to MAS 8, leveraging their extensive experience to ensure a seamless transition and superior system performance. This role is integral to our commitment to delivering technical and functional excellence in asset management systems.
 



  





**Commitment to Confidentiality** 




  





 Belmont Lavan is an equal opportunity employer and ensures that all applications will be kept strictly confidential. We encourage qualified candidates to apply and contribute to a significant project that promises not only professional fulfilment but also a chance to be part of a groundbreaking team.
 



  





**Application** 




  





 Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, a cover letter detailing their suitability for the role, and any relevant certifications. Please specify your availability and preferred working basis (full-time or part-time). We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing how you can contribute to our commitment to operational excellence and innovation in asset management solutions.

title: Frontend utvecklare (Angular, Redux)
description:
Liminity grundades med en vision om ett bolag där alla trivs, alla är en del av bolaget och alla får sin bit av kakan. Vi är trötta på reguljära företag där man bara är ett kugghjul i det stora maskineriet.

* Delta i kodgranskningar för att upprätthålla kodstandard och säkerställa kvalitetskontroll.
* Kontinuerligt förbättra produktens läsbarhet, säkerhet och användarupplevelse.


 Dina kompetenser

* Stark förståelse för HTML, CSS och JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med RESTful och/eller GraphQL API:er.

* God kommunikationsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta i team.

* Vana att arbeta med CI/CD pipelines och versionshantering med Git.

 Förmåner och Utvecklingsmöjligheter på Liminity
   

  

* Delta i innovativa projekt med ledande kunder inom branschen.
* Konkurrenskraftigt lönetillägg och förmåner.
* Utforska mer på vår handbok.


 Känns detta som en spännande möjlighet för dig? Ansök idag och bli en del av Liminity!

title: Java utvecklare (Jakarta EE, AWS)
description:

 Meriterande erfarenheter

* Konkurrenskraftiga löner och attraktiva förmåner
* Läs mer om oss och våra erbjudanden i vår handbok


 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär som Java-utvecklare? Ansök idag och bli en del av Liminity - framtidens IT-konsultbolag!

title: Backend utvecklare
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Programmering i alla dess former! T ex par-, mobprogrammering eller kanske någon ny kreativ idé som du vill utforska?
* Aktivt delta i beslut gällande produkter, features, arkitektur och affärsmål
* Lärande och kunskapsdelning i både team och organisation


 Att jobba som Backend utvecklare
   

  

 Är du redo för något intressant? På SBAB jobbar vi värderingsdrivet.
   

  

 Wow! Hoppas vi att du tänker, men vi förstår om det inte känns som något nytt eller om ordet inte väcker det intresse som vi vill. Men våra värderingar är viktiga för oss på riktigt!
   

  

 De handlar om att jobba smart med fart, ta ansvar hela vägen, vara stolta proffs och att lyckas tillsammans. Faktum är att värderingarna hjälper oss att fatta kloka beslut – och vi vill att du gör detsamma hos oss.
   

  

 De hjälper dig i rätt riktning, stöttar att ta egna initiativ, ha roligt tillsammans, jobba ihop och bidra till att våra kunder får en bättre boendeekonomi.
   

  

 Hos oss jobbar de flesta Backend utvecklare med Java (17/18/21). Vår tech stack innehåller även Spring Boot, Dropwizard, Kafka, Docker och CI/CD i Gitlab. Vi följer även AI resan och använder oss av AI Co-pilot när vi utvecklar!
   

  

 Till ett av våra team söker vi dig som har intresse och kunskap kring koncepten för authentication och authorization och har jobbat mycket med spring-security och implementerat Oauth2 resource server/clients och/eller authorization server.
   

  

 Som person är du en lagspelare som gillar att förvandla bra idéer till features och har en bra balans mellan kvalitet och leverans. Du kommer uppmuntras att gå utanför din comfortzone, pröva nya teknologier och växa som utvecklare.
   

  

 Våra team är uppdelade i produktområden och har en egen Produktägare som styr backlogen medan teamet själva driver arkitekturfrågor, tekniska beslut samt hur lösningen skall utformas.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som Backend utvecklare och som kan Svenska i tal och skrift. Vi ser även att du är van att jobba med agila arbetssätt så som Scrum & Kanban.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Ödmjuk
* Prestigelös
* Samarbetsförmåga
* Strukturerad
* Vilja att lära nytt


 Annars då?

title: App-utvecklare (iOS och Android)
description:
Vi söker nu en kreativ App-utvecklare med passion för användarvänlig design och innovativa lösningar till ett spännande konsultuppdrag hos en av våra kunder inom E-handels branschen.

* Förmåga att skriva ren, testbar kod med fokus på kvalitet och prestanda.

 Meriterande erfarenheter
   

  

* Praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines för kontinuerlig leverans av app-uppdateringar.
* Kunskaper inom appsäkerhet och skydd av användardata.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team med agila metoder.
* Relevanta certifieringar inom iOS/Android-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av backend-utveckling eller fullstack-kompetens.
* Portfolio med tidigare publicerade applikationer.


 Förmåner och utvecklingsmöjligheter på Liminity
   

  

* Omfattande utbildningsmöjligheter och certifieringar inom nya teknologier.
* Konkurrenskraftiga löner och attraktiva förmåner.
* Läs mer om oss och våra erbjudanden i vår handbok.


 Är du redo att skapa framtidens digitala upplevelser? Ansök idag och bli en del av Liminity - där vi formar morgondagens tekniska lösningar!

title: Spontanansökan IT
description:
**Är du vår nästa tech-stjärna? 🚀**
 Vi söker alltid efter drivna och skickliga utvecklare och IT-specialister som vill vara en del av vårt växande team!
   

  

**Hos Oss Får Du Möjligheten Att**
 ✅ Arbeta med spännande projekt och ny teknik
   

  

 ✅ Vara en del av en innovativ och engagerad arbetskultur
   

  

 ✅ Utvecklas tillsammans med några av branschens bästa
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som brinner för teknik och problemlösning, oavsett om du är backend-, frontend- eller fullstackutvecklare, DevOps-expert eller har andra IT-kompetenser.
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Skicka in en spontanansökan och låt oss ta ett första samtal – vi är alltid nyfikna att träffa nya talanger! ✨

title: Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Etablera och vidareutveckla plattformen för logginsamling, metrics, spårning och övervakning av hela vår stack som möjliggör insiktsdriven övervakning som stödjer både utvecklare och operativ personal.
* Säkerställa att lösningarna är skalbara, robusta och möter höga krav på tillgänglighet.
* Samordna och vägleda utvecklingsteam för att implementera observabilitetslösningar som möter verksamhetens behov.
* Driva workshops, coacha team och säkerställa att lösningarna används på ett effektivt sätt inom organisationen.
* Leda arbetet med att designa och implementera en central observabilitetsarkitektur.
* Stödja utvecklingsteam i att integrera observabilitetslösningar i sina applikationer och tjänster.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Goda till djupa kunskaper inom kubernetes, rancher, ArgoCD och andra tekniker inom utveckling och deployment av tjänster i kubernetes
* Goda till djupa kunskaper inom observabilitetstekniker så som loggning, tracing, metrics, API endpoints, prometheus
* Goda till djupa kunskaper inom Grafana suiten, exempelvis: Grafana, Grafana Loki, Grafana Alloy, Grafana Oncall


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera observabilitetslösningar i komplexa IT-miljöer på företagsövergripande nivå.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga lösningar för central logginsamling, metrics-insamling och distribuerad tracing.
* Förmåga att leda teknikval och föreslå strategiska lösningar inom observabilitet.
* Erfarenhet av att coacha utvecklingsteam och driva tvärfunktionella initiativ.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och förmåga att anpassa teknisk information till olika målgrupper.
* Hög teknisk förståelse och ett intresse för att hålla sig uppdaterad inom området.
* Vill vara en del av ett team och delar med sig av kompetens och erfarenheter med de andra


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 10-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Utvecklare
description:
Vi söker nu förstärkning till vårt IT-team i form av en driven och engagerad Microsoft Dynamics 365 utvecklare som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens IT-lösningar
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med att utveckla och underhålla våra IT-system, samt bidra till att skapa effektiva lösningar som stödjer vår verksamhet och våra kunders behov
   

  

**Hos oss gör du skillnad**
* Designa, utveckla och genomföra IT-lösningar Microsoft Dynamics 365 som uppfyller företagets mål och krav.
* Säkerställ ett sömlöst informationsflöde genom att anpassa och integrera IT-system med andra affärssystem
* Utföra djupgående analyser av kunddata för att optimera plattformens prestanda, säkerhet och funktionalitet
* Nära samarbeta med andra team för att stödja och främja företagets övergripande mål och strategier
* Arbeta enligt agila metoden SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)


**Du bidrar med din kompetens och ditt engagemang**
* Relevant examen från universitet eller högskola inom IT, datavetenskap eller liknande, samt minst 3 års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet inom området
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av att anpassa och konfigurera Microsoft Dynamics 365
* Kunskap i C#, .NET, JavaScript och SQL
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Azures tjänster
* Förståelse för och erfarenhet av API-design och integration
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila utvecklingsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och arbeta med testdriven utveckling
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att samarbeta effektivt med olika intressenter


**Meriterande**
 Erfarenhet från bygg- och fastighetsbranschen är meriterande
   

  

 Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större, komplexa IT-miljöer
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Du kommer att ha placering på Riksbyggens huvudkontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm, och flexibelt startdatum med hänsyn till din uppsägningstid. Vi har svenska som koncernspråk, så därför är det viktigt att du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Som anställd på Riksbyggen förväntas du också vara ledamot i någon/några bostadsrättsföreningar, i de fall du har ledamotsuppdrag så utgår ett ansvarsarvode.
   

  

 Riksbyggen tillämpar provanställning.
   

  

 Riksbyggen strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka.
   

  

**Har du några frågor eller funderingar?**
 Kontakta Nina Grinbergs via e-post: nina.grinbergs@riksbyggen.se
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt dynamiska team via Riksbyggen.se – Lediga jobb.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 31 mars 2025. Vi gör löpande urval, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag
   

  

 Klicka på länken om du är nyfiken på Riksbyggen. Är du nyfiken på hur det är hos oss? Till rekryteringskonsulter, annonssäljare etc. Vi har redan beslutat vilka vi samarbetar med vid rekryteringar samt var vi vill synas. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt från försäljare i dessa frågor.

title: Utvecklare inom testsystem
description:
Nexer är på en spännande tillväxtresa, och vi vill ha med dig!
   

  

 Vi söker konsulter som vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss och vara med och bygga upp vårt område inom försvarsindustrin. Vi hoppas att du brinner för en bransch där teknologisk innovation inte bara driver framsteg, utan också spelar en avgörande roll i att skydda och stärka samhället. Som Utvecklare inom testsystem kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att möta våra kunders ökade behov inom området.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, både som konsult och i teamet.
* Stor variation på uppdrag
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Högskole-eller civilingenjörsexamen inom data, inbyggda system, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet från elektronikutveckling eller -produktion
* Goda kunskaper att utveckla testutrustningar för elektronikprodukter, inklusive kretskort.
* Kunskaper kring Mentor Graphics utvecklingsmiljö
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, skriftligt och muntligt


**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi söker till flera orter: Järfälla, Karlskoga, Arboga, Linköping, Göteborg
   

  

***Om Nexer Group**
 Nexer Group är Sveriges största privatägda teknikföretag med över 2800 anställda i 15 länder. Jobbar du på Nexer får du en modig och entreprenörsdriven arbetsgivare. Vi är stolta över att leda den digitala revolutionen och vara i teknikens framkant, alltid med ett agilt och framåtlutat förhållningssätt. Här får du unika möjligheter att drömma stort, agera smart och utvecklas. Vi är ett familjeägt bolag med långsiktiga strategier, vilket innebär att du är nära de som fattar beslut och kan vara med och påverka. Dessutom har vi roligt på jobbet!*

title: Fullstackutvecklare med fokus på Microsoft applikationer
description:
Vi söker nu förstärkning till vårt IT-team i form av en driven och engagerad Fullstackutvecklare som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens IT-lösningar
   

  

 I rollen som utvecklare kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i vårt arbete med att förbättra och optimera våra kundrelationer och IT-system. Du kommer att arbeta med att utveckla och underhålla våra IT-system, samt bidra till att skapa effektiva lösningar som stödjer vår verksamhet och våra kunders behov
   

  

**Hos oss gör du skillnad**
* Designa och implementera IT-lösningar som möter företagets mål och krav
* Anpassa och integrera IT-system med andra affärssystem för att säkerställa ett sömlöst informationsflöde

**Meriterande**

 Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större, komplexa IT-miljöer
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Du kommer att ha placering på Riksbyggens huvudkontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm, och flexibelt startdatum med hänsyn till din uppsägningstid. Vi har svenska som koncernspråk, så därför är det viktigt att du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Som anställd på Riksbyggen förväntas du också vara ledamot i någon/några bostadsrättsföreningar, i de fall du har ledamotsuppdrag så utgår ett ansvarsarvode.
   

  

 Riksbyggen tillämpar provanställning.
   

  

 Riksbyggen strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka.
   

  

**Har du några frågor eller funderingar?**
