title: Solution Architect, Enterprise
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Digital Enterprise unit! This role involves contributing to our journey to become a modern, harmonized, and effective digital business. You will work with our applications for all kinds of Enterprise customers, both small and large, in the Nordics as well as Poland. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.
   

  

**In this role, you willl:**
* Have responsibility for the design of solution architecture in the Enterprise area, in addition to contributing to the overall Fortum architecture.
* Own part of the IT landscape from an architecture perspective.
* Ensure the overall validity of the architecture planning activities, and drive quality and accuracy of the architecture descriptions.
* Ensure proper level of support by technical architects, and consult and involve the technical architect in issues.
* Ensure that development activity architecture descriptions are incorporated into the architecture repository and other agreed solution architecture documentation.
* Ensure that the solution is aligned with the enterprise architecture principles and guidelines, and highlight exceptions or alignment risks.
* Collaborate with product development specialists, project managers, and business stakeholders.


**To excel in this role, you are expected to be…**
* Someone who thrives on finding innovative ways to align technology, business, and implementation. Your can-do attitude makes you a natural collaborator, and you enjoy interacting with peers to drive things forward.
* Ideally experienced with various technologies, with a minimum requirement of experience in building modern web applications in the cloud.
* Understanding of cloud technology—ranging from management to application development. Familiarity with Microsoft Azure is preferred.
* Understanding how to plan integrations in a way that keeps architects and teams engaged and satisfied. Experience with Azure as an integration platform, and REST or GraphQL is a plus.
* Possessing solid experience in IT infrastructure, system integration, middleware platforms, API management, and related technologies. You also excel at explaining complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Experienced with at least 3 years of working in a similar role.
* A bachelor's or master's degree holder in computer science, business administration, or equivalent.
* Fluent in English, both oral and written, and preferably a local language.


 We are excited to hire individuals who are passionate about solution architecture and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 14.03.2025 at the latest. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Ulf Bergendal via email at ulf.bergendal@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Martech Consultant
description:
*Are you thrilled when you get to work in between marketing, sales, data and tech to solve complex challenges? Join Avaus and be part of the future of data-driven marketing and sales.*
**Why Avaus?**
 Avaus is a leading marketing transformation partner in the Nordics. Our mission is to foster customer-centric organisations equipped to grow and face the future by fusing the power of data & technology. We are an asset based consulting company that takes pride in cross-functional collaboration to support our clients.
   

  

 We have offices in Helsinki, Stockholm, and Munich where we work with leading B2C and B2B companies. Currently we are looking to strengthen our team with a Senior Martech Consultant in our Stockholm-office.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Marketing automation strategy and execution:** 
 You will act as a trusted advisor to clients, developing comprehensive marketing automation strategies that you will also execute on in their martech stack across channels.
   

  

**Technology and data integration:** 
 You will work in marketing automation projects from strategy to execution. Develop data-driven approaches using automation technologies, integrating customer data platforms, and creating actionable insights that increase marketing effectiveness.
   

  

**Client collaboration and enablement:** 
 You will hold workshops, training sessions, and presentations for different stakeholders at the clients and help them drive development and change.
   

  

**Skills And Qualifications**
 We are looking for a forward-thinking marketing automation expert who is eager to challenge traditional marketing approaches, and help our clients take their customer engagement strategies to the next level. You're passionate about technology, data-driven marketing, and creating future-proofed customer experiences.
   

  

* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in marketing, business, technology, or a related field.
* Experience: At least five years of proven experience in Marketing Automation within preferably both B2B and B2C environments.
* Marketing Platforms: Expertise in platforms such as Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot, HubSpot, Adobe Campaign, Braze, Voyado, or similar.
* Data & Cloud Technologies: Strong proficiency in cloud platforms (Azure, Google Cloud, AWS) and Customer Data Platforms (CDPs), with a solid understanding of data privacy and consent management.
* Paid Media Activation: Experience activating first-party data in paid media channels like Google, Meta, and LinkedIn.
* Language Skills: Fluent in both Swedish and English.


 Join us to drive marketing innovation and transform how businesses connect with their customers! Apply now to be part of our dynamic team.
   

  

**Practical Information**
 This is a permanent position with a 6 month’ probation period, based at our Stockholm office on Renstiernas gata 12. The start date is as soon as possible or by agreement. We offer a hybrid remote workplace. You will report to our Head of Delivery.
   

  

 Already feel like one of us? Send your application in English as soon as possible, but latest on the 10th of March. Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Solutions Consultant, Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a new Solutions Consulting team member in Stockholm to help accelerate our exciting journey ahead! As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to become a trusted advisor and help world-class marketers gather, analyze, and optimize their data with Funnel.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your main responsibilities include working as a sales engineer to demonstrate the value of Funnel to prospects and customers. This includes supporting them during their assessment period from a technical standpoint while sharing best practices related to gathering/managing/analyzing marketing data, especially within the context of addressing complex use cases.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with our Account Executives and Customer Success Managers as well as our Product teams to provide input on the evolution of the Funnel product.
   

  

 You will have achieved success when the prospect or customer fully understands how Funnel is foundational to helping them achieve their business goals as well as helping ongoing customers grow their business with Funnel.
   

  

**As a Solutions Consultant You Will**
* Lead technical pre-sales conversations with prospects
* Lead the implementation of Funnel as a first milestone of the Funnel journey
* Work with customers on complex marketing data use cases
* Become an expert in using the Funnel platform
* Provide input to the Product teams to make our solution even better and deliver ever-increasing value to our customers.
* Collaborate with other members of the global Solutions Consulting team on global initiatives.
* You will join the EMEA team with colleagues based in Stockholm, Dublin and London.


 If you'd like to learn more about Corinna, the Manager of the Solutions Consulting team in EMEA, and her views on leadership, check out this blog post.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a solutions-oriented, proactive product and customer evangelist with outstanding communication skills.
   

  

 You are curious, eager to learn, a team player, and seek out opportunities to help others.
   

  

 You thrive in a consultative environment where you feel comfortable being an expert and knowing how to guide, educate, and manage clear expectations of customers.
   

  

 You are detail-oriented and enjoy working with data. Going down the rabbit hole to get a deep understanding of a problem and how to solve it is something that appeals greatly to you!
   

  

**Experience & Skills**
* Around 2-4 years of experience in a solution consulting, implementation or pre-sales engineering role
* Domain knowledge of digital platforms and/or experience in working with data, marketing analytics, or performance marketing reporting
* Experience in and enjoy working in a client-facing role
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Looker Studio or similar applications
* Fluency in spoken and written English and German


**Who We Are**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Other Information**
 This role is located in our Stockholm office. At Funnel, we highly value in-person collaboration and we have an office-first approach. We work from the office a minimum of four days a week while still allowing plenty of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer months, and holidays.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
At Choreograph, part of GroupM, we’re leading the way in data-driven marketing solutions. We collaborate with the world’s most ambitious brands to solve complex challenges in media and marketing through data and technology. From econometrics and media buying algorithms to dashboards and strategic consulting, our work has an impact.
   

  

 At Choreograph, data science plays a key role in how we support some of the world’s largest brands in making informed decisions. By leveraging advanced analytics and innovative methodologies, we empower businesses to optimize their marketing strategies and uncover insights that drive real results.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about using data to solve challenging problems and want to work with brands such as Samsung, Tele2, Coca-Cola, TUI and L’oreal in a collaborative environment, this could be the perfect role for you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing team in Stockholm. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Take the lead in helping our clients understand and measure the true impact of their marketing investment using measurement methods such as Marketing mix modelling.
* You will collaborate closely with colleagues to transform technical output such as outputs from a model built using Python into clear, actionable insights. Your work will involve packaging and presenting these findings in an engaging and accessible way to inform and inspire C-level stakeholders at some of the largest companies in the Nordics.
* You will contribute to exciting and impactful projects, and be able to work on projects involving attribution modeling, experiments, and algorithm development, while also contributing to the development of automated reporting tools and other innovative data science initiatives.


**Qualifications**
 Requirements-Please note that this is an entry-level position (0–2 years of experience), so the competence level of below requirements should align with skills gained through education or limited work experience.
   

  

* Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business administration or similar.
* A curious and business-oriented mindset, with a willingness to learn about (or prior knowledge of) the marketing industry.
* Strong storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues and solutions to non-technical audiences.
* Experience from programming (we use Python as our main coding language)
* Experience applying analytical methods such as time series analysis, statistics, media mix modeling, or econometrics.
* You are fluent in both English and Swedish.
* You have a valid permit in Sweden.
* You have excellent skills in Excel and Powerpoint.


**Nice to have**
* Practical experience in a data science, analytics consultant, or similar role.
* Hands-on experience with Marketing Mix Modelling.
* Previous experience of Bayesian statistics.
* Experience with Cloud platforms, SQL, GIT, Power BI, or other relevant technologies.


**Additional Benefits At Choreograph**
* The opportunity to work with leading global and local brands in a dynamic, innovative industry.
* A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive team culture.
* Access to personal and professional development opportunities within GroupM and WPP, with clear pathways for growth.
* A centrally located office in Stockholm, with flexible hybrid work options to support work-life balance.
* Benefits, including wellness allowances, pension plans, and occupational healthcare, to support your well-being.


**Application**
 The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.
   

  

 In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Lisa Gröning (lisa.groning@choreograph.com) or Viktor Åhlén (viktor.ahlen@choreograph.com). We do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

**About GroupM**
  

  

 GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Choreograph. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.

title: Snowflake Migration
description:
About LTIMindtree
 




  





 LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.
 



  





 Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale.
 



  





**Job Details -** 




  





**Language** 
 - English
 



**Type of hiring** 
 - Full-Time Employment
 



**Working Location -** 
 Stockholm Sweden
 



**Working Model** 
 - 3 days a week from the office.
 



  





 We need a Snowpark migration candidate with strong proficiency in SQL and Scala execution in Snowpark.
 



  





**Job Description -** 




  





**Expertise in Snowflake architecture infrastructure management and optimization** 




**Ensures that Snowflakes data platform is implemented configured and maintained to support high performance scalability security and compliance** 




**SME should collaborate with architects development operations and business teams to secure implementation of Snowflake solution** 









**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**Design and implement Snowflakes technical infrastructure and configuration for optimal performance reliability and scalability** 




**Ensure that Snowflake architecture aligns with the organisation data strategy and regulatory standards including aspects like data storage compute clusters and cloud integration** 




**From a migration perspective keeping bet practices for Snowflake deployment and usage for high availability** 




**Work closely with existing platform teams to define and enforce data protection policies within Snowflake including monitoring data lineage and quality controls** 




**Implement cost optimization strategies by adjusting warehouse configuration storage management and usage monitoring Aligning infrastructure costs with the business data needs** 




**Data lifecycle management with data governance for archiving and maintain compliance with data governance policies** 




**Ensure data consistency and accuracy** 




**Troubleshoot and resolve Snowflake related issues including query performance problems data loading errors and configuration incidents** 




**Drive innovation by recommending Snowflake enhancements and tool integrations** 









**Qualifications** 




  





**7 years of experience in IT infrastructure data engineering with minimum of 3 years focused on Snowflake** 




**Excellent communication skills to translate technical concepts for both technical and nontechnical audiences** 




**Very senior knowledge in Snowflake environment and tools** 




**Deep knowledge of Snowflake architecture data modelling and data capabilities** 




**Strong proficiency in SQL and Scala execution in Snowpark** 




**Strong knowledge in cloud platforms** 




**Previous experience in the banking domain is a plus**

title: Solutions Consultant - Nordics
description:
The
 **Solutions Consultant** 
 is a Pre-Sales role, responsible for listening to prospects’ challenges and gathering their requirements in order to offer specific technical subject matter expertise to the sales function, supporting the functional aspects of Workiva's platform and solutions via presentations and value-based product demonstrations of the Workiva platform.
   

  

 The Solutions Consultant role is focused on supporting our Sales Team across large organizations and financial institutions predominantly in the Nordics market. As a Pre-Sales Consultant, you will engage with prospects to identify their needs, prepare and lead demos, and showcase how our solutions meet their requirements. Leveraging your industry expertise around finance and / or sustainability, you will act as a trusted advisor throughout the sales process. This role offers the opportunity to expand your skills and work alongside top SaaS professionals, with continuous learning and growth opportunities. There is also potential for international travel for strategic deals and office visits.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Interact with prospects to determine their software needs and become a trusted advisor by demonstrating how the Workiva solutions meet those business needs
* Gain a deep understanding of our products and excel in articulating its benefits to prospects. Use storytelling to connect its features to their business needs, and provide prompt, accurate responses to their technology-related inquiries.
* Prepare and deliver technical presentations explaining products or services to prospective customers or at events e.g. webinars, conferences, etc.
* Actively contribute to cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and customer success, by offering creative solutions and responsiveness, thereby enhancing value for both your sales team and assigned prospects.
* Collect feedback from the field and provides it to Product Marketing and Product Development for further improvements of the current solutions
* Strong knowledge of Workiva products and regulations through a commitment to ongoing training


**What You’ll Need**
 Minimum Qualifications
   

  

* Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in a related field
* 4 years + of related experience in technology consulting, financial and/or sustainability processes or software sales / pre-sales
* Fluency in English and Finnish, Swedish or Norwegian


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Comprehensive understanding of the internal processes of a company’s finance function
* Knowledge and experience in one or more areas of Workiva’s platform - Sustainability, financial reporting,, FP&A or related
* Ability to assess business needs and deliver a value-based, compelling software demonstration
* Experience in process improvement consulting
* Experience with business intelligence technologies, databases or data management platforms (SAP, Oracle, Workday)
* Creative, entrepreneurial mindset
* Proven problem-solving skills and business acumen
* Determined, roll up your sleeves attitude
* Excellent client-facing presentation skills
* Proven project and time management skills
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, successfully multi-tasking and determining priorities to meet deadlines
* Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent MS Excel and presentation skills


**Travel Requirement and Working Conditions**
* Up to 40% travel for customer and internal meetings
* Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office


 Workiva is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, gender identity, race, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic.
   

  

 Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
   

  

 Workiva employees are required to undergo comprehensive security and privacy training tailored to their roles, ensuring adherence to company policies and regulatory standards.

title: Senior SAP Tester
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and IT System Testing and Evaluation
description:
**Senior SAP Tester – Join a Leading Consultancy Supporting E-commerce Transformation in Sweden!** 




 Are you an experienced Senior SAP Tester looking for an exciting long-term project with a top-tier e-commerce company? This is an incredible opportunity to work with cutting-edge SAP solutions and play a pivotal role in the digital transformation of one of the leading players in online retail.
 



  





  





**About the Company:** 




 The company is a highly regarded consultancy that has been at the forefront of delivering technology solutions across a variety of industries for over a decade. While SAP is one of their key offerings, they specialise in a broad range of services, including digital transformation, cloud solutions, data
 
 analytics, and enterprise application development, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.
 



  





  





 They have built strong, lasting relationships with global leaders in sectors like retail, finance, manufacturing, and more. Their team is known for its technical excellence and innovative approach, helping businesses optimise operations and embrace emerging technologies. Joining this consultancy means becoming part of a dynamic, forward-thinking environment that fosters collaboration, continuous learning, and a commitment to delivering value-driven solutions to clients.
 



  





  





**The Project:** 




 For this role, the consultancy is collaborating with a leading global e-commerce company to implement and test a SAP solution that will help drive the client’s digital transformation efforts. This project will focus on enhancing business processes, increasing operational efficiency, and supporting the e-commerce company’s rapid growth.
 



  





  





**About the Role:** 




 As a Senior SAP Tester, you’ll play a key role in ensuring the functionality, performance, and seamless integration of SAP solutions, working closely with the consultancy and their e-commerce client. Your contributions will be critical in validating and optimising the systems that support the client’s e-commerce platform.
 



  





  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Testing SAP solutions end-to-end, ensuring high performance, superior user experience, and flawless system integration
* Designing and executing detailed test cases, documenting results, and troubleshooting any issues that arise during testing.
* Collaborating with developers, business analysts, and project managers to ensure alignment with both business and technical requirements.
* Conducting performance and integration testing to validate the scalability and stability of SAP systems, especially for high-traffic e-commerce environments.
* Utilizing automated testing tools to increase testing efficiency and repeatability.
* Reporting defects and risks clearly to project stakeholders, ensuring timely issue resolution and project progress.
* Advising on SAP testing best practices and contributing to the successful implementation of the project phases, from pre-production through to go-live.
* Troubleshooting system issues and performing root cause analysis to resolve problems efficiently.



  





  





**Who We’re Looking For:** 



* Previous experience working with SAP, with a focus on testing in enterprise environments.
* Strong expertise in manual and automated testing for SAP solutions, with experience in performance testing and integration testing.
* Proficiency with SAP and Java-based testing tools.
* Experience in e-commerce systems is a plus, as this role involves working with high-traffic, customer-facing SAP systems.
* A collaborative mindset, capable of working effectively with both business and technical teams
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, particularly in complex scenarios.
* Excellent communication skills, able to convey technical issues and results clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* SAP Certification is desirable, though not essential.
* Experience with Agile methodologies is beneficial.



  





  





**What’s on Offer:** 



* Competitive salary (60,000 – 70,000 SEK/month) based on experience.
* A company culture that thrives on collaboration and openness – enjoy after-works, team trips, tech talks, and a relaxed, non-hierarchical environment.
* Modern office in Liljeholmen, with a strong international presence and global projects.
* 5 weeks annual leave to recharge and enjoy work-life balance.
* Growth opportunities in an ever-evolving consultancy environment that supports both personal and professional development.



  





  





 If you’re passionate about SAP testing and want to be part of a consultancy that delivers transformative solutions for global clients, while working on exciting e-commerce projects, then please apply and call Rebecca.

title: Senior Service Delivery Manager
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker dig med ett brinnande intresse för att leda och ständigt förbättra, ett stort engagemang och med viljan att bli en del av ett passionerat team! Vi har en spännande och utmanande tid framför oss och behöver nu växa med fler Service Delivery Managers.
   

  

 Som Service Delivery Manager och konsult hos oss på CGI får du möjlighet att vara med och förändra på riktigt. Du får skapa lösningar tillsammans med våra kunder, som bidrar till att skapa hållbara resultat för det samhälle vi lever i. Det kan handla om att skapa effektiva och innovativa lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att leverera bättre service, öka sin säkerhet eller effektivisera sin verksamhet.
   

  

 Inom vår enhet Manufacturing & Transportation har vi mångårig erfarenhet av förvaltning och vidareutveckling av applikationer åt våra kunder. Vi arbetar ofta tillsammans i team med flertal stora kunder inom det breda spektrum av branscher CGI verkar inom.
   

  

 Vår kultur präglas av delaktighet, professionalism, engagemang och nyfikenhet i vad framtidens IT-landskap bär med sig.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Att jobba som Service Delivery Manager på CGI innebär en omväxlande vardag.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha en central roll genom att du är den primära kontaktytan och har övergripande ansvar för åtaganden kring förvaltning och vidareutveckling av våra kunders applikationer. I ansvaret ingår att säkerställa att vi möter de SLA och KPI vi har inom åtagandet samt att ständigt förbättra och utveckla åtagandet. Leveransen kan även vara global och bedrivas delvis från exempelvis Indien och Filipinerna.
   

  

 Ständig utveckling och förbättring är en del av din vardag och du kommer även ansvara för att driva förbättringsprojekt löpande med en tydlig rapporteringsväg till åtagandets ledningsgrupp. Du får möjlighet att sätta riktning och leda utveckling.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även:
   

  

* Bygga en relation med kundens operativa IT kontakter, s. Representera kundens intresse internt för att matcha kundernas förväntningar med levererade tjänster och det avtal som slutits mellan kund och leverantör.
* Arbeta för att utveckla nya affärsmöjligheter i samverkan med övriga CGI team.
* Ansvara för finansiell rapportering (övergripande.)
* Ta fram, analysera och presentera SLA-rapporter och KPI-rapporter till kund.
* Arbeta nära både kund och leverans för att bidra med att möta kundernas ökade krav på proaktivitet och partnerskap.
* Upprätta en handlingsplan när avtalade servicenivåer riskerar att inte nås, samt driva och kommunicera den både internt och externt.
* Arbeta efter CGI:s ramverk för styrning, samverkan och leverans av tjänster.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

* + 5 års erfarenhet som Service Delivery Manager i omfattande kundleveranser alternativt senior projektledare.
* God förmåga att upprätthålla relationer med kunder på alla nivåer.
* Lyhörd och bra på att kommunicera, samt att du har förmågan att fatta beslut som för oss framåt.
* Driven och initiativtagande.


**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Om du har frågor om rollen, hör gärna av dig till rekryterande ledare Annika Widell, Director Consulting Services/ Konsultchef, på annika.widell@cgi.com
   

  

 Personliga säkerhetskrav kommer att krävas om rollen kräver det.
   

  

**Vad CGI erbjuder dig**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Product Area Architect
description:
*Länsförsäkringar befinner sig mitt i en spännande digital transformationsresa – och vi vill ha dig med på resan! Vi bygger framtidens IT-infrastruktur med fokus på automation, self-service och hybridmolnlösningar. Nu söker vi en driven och strategisk Product Area Architect inom Private Cloud Platforms som vill vara med och skapa innovativa och affärsdrivande lösningar.*
*Vill du forma framtidens digitala infrastruktur?*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Product Area Architect kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i vår förflyttning mot Hybrid Cloud. Du får chansen att forma och vidareutveckla vår infrastruktur och säkerställa en sammanhållen och effektiv arkitektur i en komplex IT-miljö. Du samarbetar tätt med team och stakeholders för att driva utvecklingen av moderna infrastrukturtjänster som stödjer Länsförsäkringars affärsutveckling.
   

  

 Vår vision är att skapa en flexibel och säker IT-miljö där SD-WAN, SDN, Zero Trust och hybridinfrastrukturtjänster blir nyckelkomponenter. Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka och forma framtidens IT-lösningar tillsammans med engagerade kollegor i en organisation som satsar på innovation och digitalisering.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Ansvara för den övergripande arkitekturen inom hybridmolnplattformar för Compute, Data och Network.
* Stötta produktteam vid utveckling av nya produkter och lösningar samt hålla produktroadmaps uppdaterade.
* Dokumentera och utveckla arkitektur (HLD, LLD) i linje med våra strategiska mål.
* Driva innovation och kontinuerlig utveckling inom IT-infrastruktur med fokus på SDN, SD-WAN, Zero Trust och Global Load Balancing.
* Samarbeta med olika arkitektroller och stakeholders för att säkerställa en effektiv och framtidssäkrad arkitektur.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som brinner för IT-arkitektur, innovation och förändring. Du är en strategisk tänkare som förstår både tekniska och affärsmässiga behov, samt har en naturlig förmåga att skapa trygghet och tydlighet i komplexa förflyttningar.
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt med fokus på hybrid IT-infrastruktur (on-prem & public cloud, framför allt Azure).
* Gedigen erfarenhet av SDN, SD-WAN, SASE och Zero Trust.
* Fördjupad kunskap inom serverhårdvara, virtualisering och operativsystem (Linux/Windows).
* Erfarenhet av databasplattformar som Oracle, MongoDB och MSSQL.
* God kännedom om Azure IaaS, PaaS och cloud-native teknologier.
* Ett starkt IT-säkerhetstänk.
* Erfarenhet från reglerade branscher som bank och försäkring är meriterande.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Digital & IT- enheten på Länsförsäkringar AB, vi stolta över att vara i centrum av vår teknologiska utveckling. Vi levererar innovativa IT-lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt och säkerställer att vi alltid ligger steget före. Vårt team av dedikerade experter arbetar tillsammans för att skapa en IT-miljö som är både säker och skalbar, vilket möjliggör för våra affärsenheter att nå nya höjder. Vi är här för att göra skillnad, varje dag.
   

  

 Gruppen Private Cloud Platforms inom Development Solutions & Operation Platforms levererar tillgängliga, säkra och stabila hybrida IT-infrastrukturtjänster till Länsförsäkringar för att möta nuvarande och framtida behov. Vi befinner oss i centrum av en spännande digital förflyttning som kräver utveckling av agila arbetssätt och nya leveransmodeller. Du kommer att samarbeta med produktteam, Product Owners, Product Experts, samt andra arkitekter inom enheten och rapportera till chefen för Private Cloud Platforms.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan och bli en del av vår resa mot framtidens digitala lösningar!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-24**

title: Supplier Data Specialist
job_function: Supply Chain, Purchasing, and Information Technology
description:
**At OX2, your work will make a lasting impact.** 
 Guided by our mission, values, and frameworks such as our Code of Conduct and sustainability strategy, we are dedicated to accelerating access to renewable energy, driving the transition toward a sustainable future. Join OX2 and become part of a team that is making meaningful progress while advancing your career. Together, let’s power the great shift.
 



  





**Position Overview** 




 The Supplier Data Specialist is responsible for maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of supplier information, ensuring data integrity, and supporting procurement and compliance processes. This role involves managing supplier documentation, facilitating supplier onboarding processes, and ensuring alignment with organizational policies and regulatory standards.
 



  





 You will report to Head of Indirect Procurement as a part of the group purchasing team. In this role you will drive process and system improvements, supporting business stakeholders and purchasers to increase efficiency in purchasing processes. In the ongoing ERP system implementation at OX2, you will play a crucial role in setting up the correct data structure to ensure seamless data flow in the new system environment.
 



  





**Your main responsibilities:** 



* Maintain and update supplier records, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and efficiency in data management.
* Coordinate supplier onboarding and manage required documentation, ensuring compliance with internal and regulatory standards.
* Monitor supplier records for compliance, and identify potential risks, recommending corrective actions.
* Generate reports on supplier performance and compliance metrics, supporting procurement decisions.
* Drive process improvements and refine supplier record management systems and best practices.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Data Management, or related field.
* 2-4 years in supplier management, procurement, or data administration.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and ERP systems (e.g., IFS Cloud).
* Strong data structuring, compliance knowledge, and understanding of data protection regulations.
* Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to drive change.



  





**About OX2** 




 OX2 develops, constructs, sells, owns, and operates large-scale renewable energy solutions. Our project portfolio includes in-house developed and acquired projects in onshore and offshore wind, solar, and energy storage, across various phases of development. We are also engaged in developing projects based on other renewable energy technologies, such as hydrogen. OX2 operates in ten markets across Europe and Australia, employing around 500 people with our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. OX2 is owned by EQT, one of the world’s largest private equity investors.
 



  





**www.ox2.com**

title: Finance Solution Architect
description:
Join Cegeka Business Solutions Team At Cegeka, we are pioneers in the IT industry, delivering high quality solutions in primarily Pharma & Life Science industry, according to industry best practices.
   

  

 As we expand our team, we're dedicated to finding individuals who embody the perfect blend of competencies, character, and ambition, ensuring we continue to exceed expectations in every project we undertake. Cegeka continuously invests in talent management through clearly defined growth paths and an extensive range of training programs.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 As a Solution Architect and Business Application Consultant specializing in Finance in D365FO at Cegeka, you'll be integral to the success of the implementation lifecycle. You will be reporting to the Business Unit Lead for Cegeka Business Solutions Sweden. Your role will involve understanding our clients' Finance processes/challenges, designing innovative solutions using standard MS Dynamics 365FO features and Microsofts' vision Modern Finance, and guiding them through seamless transitions to optimize their operations through the entire lifecycle of the implementation.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Client Needs Assessment: Dive deep into understanding the intricacies of our clients' finance requirements to ensure our solutions perfectly align with their objectives.
* Solution Design: Utilize your expertise in D365FO, embracing Microsoft's vision Modern Finance, together with our extensive processes catalogue to address client-specific finance challenges.
* Configuration and Development: Drive the configuration and development of D365FO standard, using Cegeka industry templates and strong methodology.
* Customer assistance: Offer unwavering support throughout the implementation process, including training key users, providing assistance, and facilitating the smooth migration of systems.
* Post-Implementation Guidance: Provide ongoing support and guidance to clients, ensuring they achieve sustained success and maximum efficiency both before and after go-live.


**What are we offering:**
 A close-knit and collaborative work culture built on trust and respect, where collaboration and personal growth are encouraged.
   

  

* A Comprehensive Training and personal development program, securing that you are best in class and always up to date.
* A solid salary package that matches your education and work experience. At Cegeka you are covered by a collective agreement. We also offer health care contributions, health insurance and greenbike (benefit bicycle).
* You will join a dedicated and experienced team with different competences to support you on your further journey.
* An onboarding program with an appointed buddy for your support.
* An enjoyment and motivated team that celebrates successes together, and helps you achieve your goals.
* Challenging and interesting work in an open and flexible work culture, where your opinion is valued.
* An opportunity to develop within our local, European and Global team.


**What you need to succeed:**
* You have a bachelor's or master's degree or related experience within Finance and Business Administration.
* You have several years of experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365FO implementations or experience with other ERP systems
* Experience in Finance processes within the Pharma & Life Science industry is a plus.
* You have experience with Analysis, Solution Design, Configuration, workshop facilitation & Testing.
* You are proactive, result-driven, and take initiative. You have strong ambitions to contribute to a success story.
* You are fluent in English and Swedish


**About Cegeka Global**
 Discover Cegeka, a leader driving digital transformation globally with 9000+ employees. With a diverse range of cutting-edge digital services and solutions tailored to meet evolving needs of businesses, Cegeka stands at the forefront of innovation. From cloud services to IT consulting, software development to system integration, and infrastructure management, Cegeka offers comprehensive solutions designed to drive businesses forward. Headquarters in Belgium, our reach extends globally, bringing our expertise to companies in multiple countries.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Experis. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact recruitment consultant Pia Boström at 0703 14 68 66, pia.bostrom@se.experis.com
   

  

**About Cegeka Sweden**
 Our presence in the Swedish market marks the beginning of an exciting journey where we strive to deliver high-quality services and innovative solutions that help our customers needs. We are committed to deliver personalized digital services and perfectly aligned with the unique requirements of Swedish business. With the support of our mother company in Belgium, we have access to a broad knowledge base and technical expertise that equips us to meet and exceed our customers' expectations.
   

  

 With a total of 60+ employees and offices in Stockholm, Linköping, Gävle, and Falun, we are able to empower Swedish companies with state-of-the-art IT solutions, helping them overcome challenges and achieve success efficiently. You can work from the office that is most suitable for you and your employment.
   

  

 We have nice offices with an open work environment. We work well in smaller teams and the overall feeling is very family-oriented with close cooperation. We prioritize to enjoy time with our colleagues and gathering different conferences, summer parties, Christmas parties, activities and after works.

title: Senior Data Engineer, Financial Data Services
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves overseeing data engineering activities, building data processing frameworks, and working with data architects. You will strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Provide senior-level contribution to a team that is responsible for the design, deployment, and maintenance of the business’s data platforms.
* Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business.
* Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and lead partnerships with other Data and Analytics teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.
* Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights.


**To excel in this role, you are expected to be:**
* A master’s or bachelor’s degree holder in computer science.
* Experienced with more than 5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.
* Experienced in leading Data Engineer work.
* Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (DataBricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).
* Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
* Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.
* Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.


 We are excited to hire individuals who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 14.03.2025 at the latest.We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen via email at antti.heimonen@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: I&C-ingenjör till Vattenfall Power Solutions
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Vill du vara med och bidra till Sveriges fossilfria elförsörjning?**
 Teknikavdelningen på Business Unit Vattenfall Power Solutions utvecklar och genomför projekt och uppdrag samt tillhandahåller interna tekniska specialisttjänster i ett samlat kompetenscenter för Vattenfalls verksamheter, koncernstaber och intressenter. Detta innebär verksamhet i form av förstudier, analyser, utredningar och projektering inom samtliga av våra energislag. Fokus inom affärsenheten är att utveckla vår kompetens inom strategiska områden för att verka mot Vattenfalls utveckling mot en fossilfri framtid.
   

  

 För att möta kommande energibehov står vi nu inför en spännande framtid med nyproduktion och drifttidsförlängningar inom kärnkraften, samt modernisering av vattenkraften. Vill du vara med och bidra i denna omställning och bidra till ett fossilfritt samhälle? Vi söker nu dig som är ingenjör inom I&C (instrumenation & control/styr- och reglerteknik).
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i utmanande och utvecklande uppdrag från idéstadiet till slutprodukt, du får frihet under ansvar med stora möjligheter till distansarbete på deltid, att styra dina arbetstider och att skapa gedigna relationer i dina uppdrag. Du kommer att få arbeta med mycket kompetenta kollegor inom såväl ditt kompetensområde som inom andra discipliner. Möjligheterna till egen utveckling är stora både inom din egen organisation och Vattenfall i stort.
   

  

 Beroende på var i landet du befinner dig i kommer du att tillhöra grupperingen i väst eller öst. På västkusten består gruppen av cirka 10 medarbetare som jobbar med anläggningsdesign inom process, elkraft och I&C. På östkusten består gruppen av ca 15 medarbetare som jobbar med analys och konstruktion inom elkraft och I&C. Totalt är vi ca 20 medarbetare inom kompetensområdet elkraft och I&C och i syfte att ta tillvara på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter ingår vi i ett gemensamt funktionsområde.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Som ingenjör hos oss kommer du att arbeta med en rad olika frågeställningar med varierande komplexitet. Då vi befinner oss i en tid där vi skall förbereda för ny kärnkraft och rusta våra åldrande anläggningar att köras många år framöver, innebär arbetet att hitta innovativa lösningar som möjliggör att vi kan integrera modern teknik med befintlig, som tillsammans uppfyller moderna krav och ger hög tillgänglighet.
   

  

 Arbetet är varierande och beroende på din bakgrund, men utifrån behov hos beställande organisation kan arbetet innebära:
   

  

* identifiering och formulering av krav från anläggning och intressenter
* framtagande och värdering av konceptlösningar
* framtagande av underlag/förutsättningar för konstruktion och upphandling
* leda de tekniska delarna i genomförandefasen
* granskning av underlag för kvalitetssäkring med avseende på verifiering och validering


**Vi vet att våra anställda är nyckeln till vår framgång** 
 . För oss är din utveckling viktig och därför kommer vi alltid att uppmuntra dig till att använda dina kunskaper och ge dig möjligheter till att utvecklas genom nya utmaningar, utbildningar och kompetensöverföring. Hos oss får du förtroendet att agera med stor frihet och eget ansvar, vilket tillsammans med bra arbetsvillkor och ömsesidigt förtroende ger en hög flexibilitet och balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
* utbildning högskoleingenjör, civilingenjör eller liknande inom relevant område, alternativt motsvarande kunskaper införskaffade på annat sätt
* minst 5 års erfarenhet av I&C-system inom process- eller kraftindustrin
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift, både på svenska och på engelska
* körkort B


 Vi söker dig som drivs av att hitta smarta lösningar i komplexa system. Du har förmågan att se helheten och kopplingar till närliggande ämnesområden. Du trivs i ett självständigt arbete såväl som i en ledande roll, där du styr det tekniska arbetet. Du kan, i situationer präglade av svårigheter eller osäkerheter, genomföra ett strukturerat och kvalitativt arbete med hjälp av din analytiska förmåga och noggrannhet. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och med din lyhördhet har du lätt för att skapa och bibehålla relationer, och därtill även hantera många kontakter.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla anställda ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning.  Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle
 **erbjuder vi dig** 
 ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs gärna mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Placeringsort** 
 Solna, Göteborg, Uppsala, Västerås, Gävle, Nyköping eller Oskarshamn. Resor ingår som en naturlig del av tjänsten men vi arbetar aktivt med tekniska lösningar för att minska andelen resor.
   

  

**Denna tjänst ligger ute över flertal orter** 
 , det är samma tjänst men då den har flexibel placering annonseras den ut på olika orter. Om du är intresserad av att söka, skicka in din ansökan till den ort som är mest relevant för dig och inte till flera. Slutbesked om placeringsort kan diskuteras i nästföljande steg i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**För mer information om tjänsten kontakta:**
 rekryterande chef, Andreas Lennartsson 070-588 36 43 eller Mari Hård 070-592 49 26 rekryterande chef (väst).
   

  

**För information om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 rekryterare Sofie Söder 070-237 69 26.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter** 
 för denna tjänst är Gustaf Treiber (Akademikerna), Jan Stigbert (Unionen), Philip Carendi (Ledarna), Ingemar Eriksson (SEKO). Alla kontaktpersoner nås via Vattenfalls växel 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan** 
**senast den 23 mars 2025.**
**Vi tar inte emot personliga brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.**
 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och vår verksamhet omfattas bland annat av regler om säkerhetsskydd, nukleär icke-spridning och exportkontroll. På grund av dessa regler genomförs en kontroll av kandidaten för många av tjänsterna i vår verksamhet innan anställning sker. För de tjänster som leder till deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet eller placering i säkerhetsklass innebär denna kontroll att säkerhetsprövning genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Förutom säkerhetsprövning genomförs även drogtest.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Business Unit (BU) Vattenfall Power Solutions är en affärsenhet på ca 600 personer inom Business Area (BA) Vattenfall Generation som utbildar personal inom svensk kärnkraft, levererar kärnbränsle till Vattenfalls kärnkraftverk, utvecklar och genomför projekt och uppdrag samt tillhandahåller interna tekniska specialisttjänster för samtliga utav Vattenfalls verksamheter, koncernstaber och intressenter. Detta innebär verksamhet i form av bl.a. framtagning och tillhandahållande av utbildningar, projektledning och projektstöd, analysledning och utredning, produktframtagning, kärntekniska säkerhets- och dammsäkerhetsuppdrag. Fokus inom affärsenheten Vattenfall Power Solutions är att utveckla vår förmåga inom projektledning samt valda tekniska nyckeldiscipliner. Vi arbetar aktivt med ständiga förbättringsinitiativ och utveckling av våra modeller, där vårt arbete och kompetens skapar stora värden för Vattenfall och dess satsningar.

title: Supplier Contract Record Specialist
description:
**At OX2, your work will make a lasting impact.** 
 Guided by our mission, values, and frameworks such as our Code of Conduct and sustainability strategy, we are dedicated to accelerating access to renewable energy, driving the transition toward a sustainable future. Join OX2 and become part of a team that is making meaningful progress while advancing your career. Together, let’s power the great shift.
 



  





**Position Overview** 




 The Supplier Contract Record Specialist is responsible for maintaining and organizing supplier contract records, ensuring data accuracy, process compliance, and easy accessibility. This role supports both procurement and legal teams by managing the supplier contract repository, inputting contract data, monitoring key dates, and facilitating contract-related processes to enhance operational efficiency and risk management.
 



  





 In this role you will report to Head of Indirect Procurement as a part of the group purchasing team. You will drive improvements in contract coverage and contract record management, while promoting contract compliance across the business.
 



  





 In OX2's ongoing ERP system implementation, the Supplier Contract Record Specialist will play a key role in setting up the correct contract data and structure within the system to ensure seamless flow and proper use of contract data in day-to-day operations.
 



  





**Your main responsibilities:** 



* Maintain a centralized database for contract documents, ensuring compliance with internal policies, legal requirements, and key milestones.
* Implement and manage systems for efficient contract tracking, while continuously improving workflows and data integrity.
* Collaborate with procurement, legal, and finance teams to ensure contracts adhere to internal processes and standards.
* Provide training to stakeholders and act as the primary point of contact for contract-related inquiries.
* Analyze contract data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities for process improvements.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Legal Studies, or related field.
* 2-4 years in contract management or a similar role.
* Proficiency in contract management software (e.g., IFS Cloud, SAP Ariba), advanced Excel skills, and knowledge of supplier contracts, legal standards, and CLM tools.
* Strong attention to detail, communication, organizational skills, and cross-functional collaboration experience.



  





**About OX2** 




 OX2 develops, constructs, sells, owns, and operates large-scale renewable energy solutions. Our project portfolio includes in-house developed and acquired projects in onshore and offshore wind, solar, and energy storage, across various phases of development. We are also engaged in developing projects based on other renewable energy technologies, such as hydrogen. OX2 operates in ten markets across Europe and Australia, employing around 500 people with our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. OX2 is owned by EQT, one of the world’s largest private equity investors.
 



**www.ox2.com**

title: Senior Vice President of Sales
company_industry: Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and HVAC and Refrigeration Equipment Manufacturing
description:
IV Produkt står inför en fortsatt internationell expansion och söker nu en strategisk och resultatorienterad ledare för att driva försäljning och marknadsföring på den europeiska marknaden utanför Sverige.
 



  





**Rollbeskrivning** 



* Leda och utveckla vår europeiska sälj- och marknadsorganisation för fortsatt tillväxt. I rollen ansvarar du för en organisation bestående av Europaavdelningen och för närvarande tre dotterbolag i Norge, England och Tyskland, totalt ca 30 medarbetare. Utöver dotterbolagen har vi ett tiotal partners i olika länder som säljer och marknadsför våra produkter.
* Utveckla och implementera strategier för att stärka vår marknadsposition inom hållbara ventilationslösningar.
* Identifiera affärsmöjligheter och driva expansion i befintliga och nya europeiska marknader.
* Bygga starka relationer med nyckelkunder och partners inom bygg- och fastighetssektorn.



  





 Du kommer att rapportera direkt till VD och ingå i företagets ledningsgrupp.
 



  





**Den profil vi sök** 



* Har gedigen erfarenhet av teknisk försäljning inom byggrelaterade produkter, gärna ventilation, kyla eller energioptimering. Erfarenhet från ett flertal europeiska marknader är meriterande.
* God erfarenhet av internationella affärer med bra kontaktnät.
* Förstår marknadens behov och kan driva innovativa lösningar inom energieffektivitet och hållbarhet.
* Är en stark ledare med affärsdriv och förmåga att skapa långsiktiga strategi.
* Erfarenhet av uppstart av dotterbolag och partner.



  





 Som person är du en ledare med stort intresse för människor och internationell tillväxt. Du är coachande och kommunikativ och strävar efter att utveckla och inkludera medarbetarna. Vidare har du en god organisatorisk förmåga samt är noggrann, strategiskt och har god teknisk förståelse.
 



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Växjö, men vi prioriterar erfarenhet och personliga egenskaper och välkomnar även sökande placerad på annan ort som är öppen för att resa.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
****The role****
 We are looking for a
 **Lead Data Engineer** 
 to modernise our
 **Corporate – Player Sustainability, Finance, Legal, and Regulatory** 
 data infrastructure, focusing on cloud technologies, next-generation data warehousing and Self-Serve Analytics
   

  

 This role required expertise in working with data warehouse platforms, managing data pipelines and deliver end to end data engineering project. You will work closely with cross-function teams, designing and implementing scalable cloud solutions that seamlessly integrate and optimise business operations.
   

  

****What you will do****
* Design, develop, test, and support data-driven solutions while providing technical and design expertise.
* Lead and contribute to technical planning, requirements gathering, and the delivery of high-quality data products.
* Establish and enforce development best practices while mentoring team members and driving data governance policies across team.
* Solve complex architectural challenges by working collaboratively with architects, developing optimal solutions that span across multiple teams supporting your business domains.
* Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends to ensure our data infrastructure remains cutting-edge.
* Be a pioneer in automation testing methods and tools to improve the quality of the data platform.
* Support and maintain data products, including on-call support & incident management, and by following up on solutions to the incidents; define metrics and measurements, proving the solution is optimal in the long term.
* Establish good relationships with your team and stakeholders, working in an Agile way with open communication.
* Be a consultant early on for new data projects and initiatives, working across different technical teams, architects to drive initiatives.
* Support Engineering Managers by proactively identifying skill gaps and help upskilling team members by developing and delivering training materials and leading training sessions.
* Conducting proof of concept (POC) evaluations of tools and technologies, and presenting findings to assist leadership in decision-making


****Your experience****
* Strong data engineering background, with experience in designing and building AWS cloud data lake, data pipelines, data warehouse and self-service solutions
* Experience delivering large-scale transformation projects with a focus on end-to-end data architecture
* Extensive experience with AWS services (S3, Redshift, Lambda) including data storage, computation, and security.
* Experience with BI tools such as Power BI, AWS Quicksight
* Familiarity with open-source data-stack tools (Airflow, DBT, Airbyte)
* Good understanding of software development best practices, CI/CD
* Experience inperformance tuning and optimization.
* Strong experience with automation, testing, and CI/CD pipelines in data engineering.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence decision-making across all teams and stakeholders.
* Previous leadership experience in technical projects, with a track record of leading teams effectively.

Work with vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed. Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution. Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents. title: Sales Manager Nordic Countries- ABB Robotics
description:
**Sales Manager Nordic Countries- ABB Robotics**
================================================

#### **Join Us as a Sales Manager and Drive the Growth of the Robotics Market! At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


As Sales Manager for ABB Robotics Sweden, Denmark and Norway, you will play a key role in driving profitable growth and strengthening ABB’s position as the leading provider of robotics solutions. You will lead and develop the Swedish sales team, working closely with customers and partners to accelerate automation across various industries. With a strong focus on strategic sales execution, market expansion, and customer engagement, you will be responsible for shaping the future of robotics in the Nordic region. Your responsibilities include leading and developing the Swedish sales team to achieve ambitious growth targets. You will define and implement the sales strategy for ABB Robotics in Sweden, Denmark and Norway, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Additionally, you will drive sales of ABB’s full robotics portfolio, including robots, accessories, function packages, robot cells, and turnkey solutions. Developing and nurturing key customer relationships to ensure ABB remains the preferred partner in robotics automation is also a key part of the role. You will identify and engage with new customers and industries to expand ABB’s market share and strengthen ABB’s partner network, with a focus on system integrators and machinery OEMs. Furthermore, you will collaborate with global and Nordic teams to drive innovation, best practices, and cross-border opportunities. Monitoring market trends and competitor activities to proactively adapt sales strategies is essential. Lastly, you will ensure high customer satisfaction by focusing on quality, reliability, and longterm partnerships.

### **Qualifications for the role**

* Motivated leader with a passion for sales, automation, and business development.
* 5+ years of experience in B2B sales, preferably within robotics, automation, or industrial solutions.
* 5+ years of leadership experience with a strong ability to motivate and develop teams.
* Proven success in strategic sales and account management, preferably in the Swedish industrial market.
* Strong business acumen and a results-driven approach.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Experience in working with partners, integrators, and OEM customers.
* Fluent in Swedish and English (both written and spoken).
* Willingness to travel within Sweden, Norway and Denmark and occasionally internationally.

title: Research Engineer in Machine Learning
description:
**Halmstad University**


Work at a University where different perspectives meet!  

  

Halmstad University adds value, drives innovation and prepares people and society for the future. Since the beginning in 1983, innovation and collaboration with society have characterised the University's education and research. The research is internationally reputable and is largely conducted in a multidisciplinary manner within the University's two focus areas: Health Innovation and Smart Cities and Communities. The University has a wide range of education with many popular study programmes. The campus is modern and well-equipped, and is situated close to both public transportation and the city center.


More information about working at Halmstad University: https://hh.se/english/about-the-university/vacant-positions.html

 **The School of Information Technology**


Halmstad University consists of four interdisciplinary Schools and the current position is located at the School of Information Technology (ITE). ITE is a multicultural school with around 130 employees from 20 different countries. It is a strong research and education environment, with focus on smart technology and its applications. Students and researchers are working with everything from AI and information driven care to autonomous vehicles, social robotics and digital design. ITE offers education on all levels, from undergraduate to PhD education, plus education for professional. Research is conducted within aware intelligent systems, smart electronic systems, cyber physical systems and digital service innovation. These four areas constitute the four technology areas of ITE . An innovation centre for information driven care called Leap for Life is connected to ITE, as well as a collaboration arena for electronic development, Electronics Centre in Halmstad (ECH).


More information about the School of Information Technology: hh.se/ite-en

 **Description**


This is a temporary position (11 months) and requires a combination of many different skills related to software development, machine learning and programming, but goes well beyond the typical scope of such jobs through the expectation of research experience in machine learning. Therefore, we need a person who is creative, open to new challenges, and passionate about delivering high quality results. The work is mainly intended to be performed in relation to automotive applications.

  

The research engineer is expected to support research and researchers in many various cutting-edge AI/ML topics, including data mining, context-aware systems, knowledge-based intelligent systems, representation learning, meta-learning, transfer learning, multi-task, self-supervised and weakly-supervised learning, federated learning, anomaly detection, synthetic data generation, graph neural networks, evaluation, and more.  

  

**Qualifications**

* M.S. degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Machine learning or related discipline.
* A strong background in machine learning, artificial intelligence, data mining, or signal processing is desirable.
* Excellent programming skills, analytical problem solving and organizational abilities are required.

 **Salary**  

Salary is to be determined by negotiation. The application should include a statement of the salary level required by the candidate.

 **Application**  

Applications should be sent via Halmstad University's recruitment system Varbi (see link on this page).  

How to design your application

 **General Information:**


We value the qualities that gender balance and diversity bring to our organisation. We therefore welcome applicants with different backgrounds, gender, functionality and, not least, life experience.  

  

The working language is English and no knowledge of Swedish is required to start working at the University. Also for daily life, English is spoken widely and Sweden has the highest English Proficiency index in the world. Of course, it’s advisable that the employee learn Swedish.


Halmstad is a popular summer destination located on the Swedish west coast. It is situated halfway between two cosmopolitan areas: the Copenhagen-Malmö-Lund area and the Gothenburg area, making it a well-connected, yet a pleasantly calm place to live. Halmstad can be reached by a direct train connection from the Copenhagen Kastrup Airport, as well as other local airports (e.g., Gothenburg Landvetter Airport, Halmstad, and Helsingborg/Ängelholm airports).

title: ML engineer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****> 12 months**
  
We are looking for ML engineer for a consultancy assignment in Malmö.


Start: ASAP


Duration: a long term project, starting with 6-12 months contract.


Location: Malmö (5 days onsite)

 **Description**


In this role you'll be responsible for building machine learning based systems and conduct data analysis that improves the quality of our Find My features. You’ll be developing time-series models to extract information, using outlier detection to identifying anomalies and applying data science methods to quantify the quality of our data. You will take part in the development, integration, hardening and deployment of the models at scale, which would require a good combination of data science and software engineering.

 **Responsibilities**

* Development of machine learning models
* Building and maintaining software development solutions
* Provide insights by applying data science methods
* Take ownership of delivering features and improvements on time

 **Must-have Qualifications**

* Able to wear multiple hats, do what it takes ability and attitude
* Strong programming skills and extensive experience with Python
* Professional experience working with machine learning and data science, such as classification, feature engineering, clustering, anomaly detection and neural networks
* Fine tuning and iterating on models
* Knowledgeable in classic machine learning algorithms (SVM, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, KNN etc).
* Experience using deep learning libraries and platforms, such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras
* Experience with frameworks such as Sklearn, Numpy, Pandas
* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills

 **Extra Merit Qualifications**

* Knowledge in at least one of the following: time series analysis, data mining
* Ability to do statistical modeling and building predictive models
