* Foster strong relationships with internal teams, vendors, and partners to ensure successful outsourced implementations.


**Documentation And Reporting**
* Create and maintain documentation of architectural designs, configurations, and processes.
* Document lessons learned, best practices, and guidelines for the devices and applications workplace environment.


 ,
   

  

 We are looking for you who have
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent work experience.
* At least three years of experience as tech lead or solution architect around Workplace Devices and application services, preferably in a large and complex business environment.
* Strong technical expertise in Citrix, Intune, Application Management, Print Management, and User Experience Monitoring.
* Familiarity with outsourced work environments and the ability to effectively collaborate remotely.
* Knowledge of Agile methodologies is highly desirable.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Ability to work independently and deliver results within specified timelines.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., Citrix Certified Expert - Virtualization, Microsoft Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert) are a plus.
* Experience in working with ITIL processes and frameworks.
* Swedish & English, fluent in speech and writing.


 We believe you are a person that is and has been interested in workplace devices and applications for some time already. Your way of working is inclusive, structured and responsible. You are communicative, easy to collaborate with and you ensure your way of working creates and nurtures long-term relationships.
   

  

 We offer you
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer a role that is part of our dynamic team including Service Managers, Engineers respectively a Chief Architect. The roles in Workplace are dedicated to certain solutions areas and are responsible for governing outsourced Workplace services and/or some of the internally managed services. Daily work varies in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being the favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

 Apply
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Susanne Wetterstrand on phone number: +46 72-585 32 85. Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Systems Expert
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Join Vattenfall as a** 
**Systems Expert** 
**. Here, you will shape our cutting-edge maintenance frameworks, optimize risk-based strategies, and unite global teams across onshore and offshore sites. Leveraging our SAP tools you’ll deliver innovative solutions that keep our turbines running at peak performance – all while contributing to our mission of fossil-free living.**
 You will join BU Offshore Generation in the Supply Chain and Maintenance Systems Department, specifically under Maintenance Systems Improvement team. As part of Maintenance Systems Improvement team, we focus on optimizing operational processes through SAP service execution, supporting both onshore and offshore wind operations. In this international environment, you’ll collaborate across multiple locations—Stockholm, Amsterdam, London, Berlin, Kolding—to harmonize system solutions and ensure seamless end-to-end processes for our wind operations.
   

  

**Be in your element with BA Wind**
 As part of BA Wind you will play a key role in one of the most exciting pipelines in the industry with 24GW of capacity stretching out more than a decade ahead across our key European markets.
   

  

 You won’t only be involved in developing projects but pioneering cutting-edge innovation, new business models and ways of working with communities and the environment. Working as part of a leading European utility also means you could be helping a growing number of major businesses and brands achieve their own sustainability goals through partnerships.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Your role**
 As the Systems Expert, you will be the central authority on designing, deploying, and optimizing maintenance system solutions – primarily around SAP PM (Plant Maintenance) and MM (Materials Management) – for our onshore and offshore wind operations. In this multifaceted position, you will simultaneously act as a System Project Manager, Lead Key User, Portfolio Manager, and Implementation Advisor, ensuring that maintenance systems projects are executed on time, within scope, and with full alignment among diverse stakeholders. Working closely with the Business Demand Manager, you will help chart the strategic direction for Maintenance Systems, driving continuous improvement and fostering collaboration across functions such as IT, Supply Chain, Operations/Site teams, Integrated Operations, Engineering and Finance. Your responsibilities will include owning solutions for the maintenance systems of wind (PM/MM), defining project and systems solution roadmaps, representing user needs in system configurations, shaping and prioritizing the development portfolio, and guiding the adoption of best practices. By translating technical insights into clear project requirements and bridging the gap between operations and technology, you will play a pivotal role in scaling our processes, reinforcing data-driven decision-making, and enhancing the overall effectiveness of our maintenance solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
**Project Management** 
 :
   

  

* Set up project teams, define plans, conduct stakeholder/risk analyses, and manage projects within Maintenance Systems.
* Coordinate readiness reviews, cutover plans, and go-live support, ensuring a smooth transition to production.


**Maintenance Systems Authority** 
 :
   

  

* Own system solutions for the maintenance systems of wind (PM/MM)
* Serve as the Lead Key User for the SAP solution in BA Wind (service execution & supply chain).
* Advise project teams on maintenance systems setup, spearheading business assessments and initiating change requests when needed.


**Portfolio & Stakeholder Alignment** 
 :
   

  

* Collaborate with the Business Demand Manager to develop and prioritize the portfolio of improvements in Wind Maintenance Systems.
* Engage with IT, Integrated Operations, Finance, Engineering, and site teams to gather requirements and address challenges.


**Implementation & Continuous Improvement** 
 :
   

  

* Identify potential issues, propose solutions, and recommend process changes based on project analyses.
* Document lessons learned and refine existing workflows to align with organizational standards.


**Agile Sprint Management** 
 :
   

  

* Drive detailed sprint planning, ensuring an iterative approach to enhancements in SAP functionality.
* Work closely with IT to manage development backlogs and integrate feedback across multiple stakeholders.


**Your profile**
 You are a driven professional who effortlessly combines an in-depth understanding of SAP PM and MM with a strategic, forward-thinking approach to project delivery. You enjoy transforming complex operational needs into streamlined solutions, and you excel at building collaborative relationships across diverse teams—from Finance and Engineering to site personnel and IT. With an agile mindset and solid portfolio management skills, you confidently prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment while remaining attentive to details. You approach challenges with curiosity and innovation, ensuring that key stakeholders are not just aligned but fully engaged in the process. Fluent in English, you are adept at communicating technical insights clearly, motivating others through your structured problem-solving, and delivering tangible results that optimize both onshore and offshore wind operations. Above all, you thrive in a setting where you can leverage your expertise to shape and elevate maintenance systems for the future of renewable energy.
   

  

 Next to this, you bring:
   

  

**Educational Background** 
 :
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering or a scientific discipline).


**Industry & Technical Expertise** 
 :
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in a similar position, with proven know-how in wind O&M daily operations.
* Expert user of SAP PM/MM modules, capable of guiding implementation and troubleshooting.


**Project & Portfolio Management** 
 :
   

  

* Demonstrated success driving complex projects and managing stakeholder expectations in an international setting.
* Agile-minded, skilled in sprint management and iterative solution development.


**Soft Skills** 
 :
   

  

* High proficiency in English (written and spoken); additional language skills (e.g., Danish, German) are a plus.
* Strong problem-solving capabilities and ability to build trust-based relationships with cross-functional teams.
* Structured approach to tasks, with excellent communication skills for guiding varied stakeholders.


**Why not start your journey to working for fossil freedom by applying now?**
**Location** 
 Kolding, Denmark – London, United Kingdom – Amsterdam, Netherlands – Solna/Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
**Looking for a career with growth?**
 Looking for a role where your superpowers can be leveraged to the maximum and with limitless opportunities for growth?
   

  

 The scale and ambition of our wind, battery and solar business means you can really find your element with us. We’ll also provide you with all the learning and development you need to expand your horizons.
   

  

 We strive to be the best place to work in the industry with highly competitive pay and conditions and an open, supportive culture. A commitment to a healthy work-life balance aims to ensure everyone plays to their strengths, whatever their background and experiences.
   

  

 You will be part of a growing team of 1,700+ colleagues from 50+ nationalities where our positive approach to diversity is reflected in the fact that more than a quarter of staff are women.
   

  

**More Information**
 For more information about the position, you are welcome to contact hiring manager Joyce Tibangay Westi, joycetibangay.westi@vattenfall.com. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our recruiter Christian Pathuel, christian.pathuel@vattenfall.com
   

  

 We welcome your application in English no later than 09.03.2025. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to building a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfil within Vattenfall and will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classified the final candidates might be subject to a security vetting process, according to Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We employ around 21 000 people mostly in our core markets in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK.

title: Senior Tech Lead, Data Platform
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions team! This role involves leading the Data Platform Team in DCO. You will be responsible for the data platform that supports multiple data domains, providing a unified governance solution for all data and AI assets, including files, tables, machine learning models, and dashboards in the Consumer Solutions' Databricks Lakehouse Platform & Gen AI (Data Intelligence Platforms). You will actively contribute to data democratization across Consumer Solutions and Fortum. Your role is to understand changes in markets, competition, technology, and customer behavior and turn them into decisions and execution that support all our teams to succeed. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Leading the data engineering team and collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery.
* Ensure technical excellence, using the right tools and technologies to support the team to deliver faster.
* Be responsible for overall system availability and compliance.
* Manage and coach team performance and wellbeing.
* Manage systems, licenses, budget, costs, and technology roadmap within the team scope.
* Ensure that the solutions follow Fortum policies and guidelines regarding architecture, development practices, privacy, security, etc.
* Collect functional and non-functional, security, compliance, and availability requirements from business units.


**To excel in this role, you are expected to be:**
* A bachelor's or master's degree holder in computer science, business administration, or another relevant area.
* Experienced in IT and function/business/industry.
* Experienced in leading teams.
* Experienced in SQL, Python, and data pipeline tools.
* Knowledge on Azure data tools like data factory, databricks, datalake is a plus.
* Maintaining role-based competence and training regularly.


 We are excited to hire an individual who is passionate about data platforms and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 14.03.2025 at the latest.We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at antti.heimonen@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Systemingenjör/System Engineer Manager försvar
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

 AFRY är en del av några av världens mest avancerade teknikledande lösningar inom försvar, flyg och säkerhet. Genom att vi arbetar tillsammans med kunder och lokala partners levererar vi produkter och tjänster med militär kapacitet som skyddar människor och den nationella säkerheten samt säkrar viktig information och infrastruktur.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Letar du nya utmaningar och som konsult och/eller vill ta ledaransvar i större och komplexa projekt mot försvarsindustrin eller mot våra försvarsmyndigheter?
   

  

 I vårt affärsområde Defence & Security stärker vi upp med Systemingenjörer/System Engineer Managers inom domänerna mark-, sjöluft-, ledningssystem- och logistik och vi är lokaliserade på flera kontor i Sverige. Vi ser att du blir en lokal representant för området och är beredd att ta en ledande roll som konsult i kundprojekt men även för dina arbetskamrater som också är systemingenjörer.
   

  

 Vi tror att du vill tillhöra en gemenskap av kollegor som är ingenjörer och kollegor med försvarsbakgrund, alla med olika erfarenhetsnivåer och inriktningar. Ditt ledarskap och vår gemensamma kompetens och vilja är centrala för att leverera med hög kvalitet och precision åt vår kund.
   

  

 Helhetsåtaganden ställer höga krav på oss och våra konsulter, både vad gäller kompetens och leveransförmåga. Fokus framåt, samtidigt som vi ska trivas och ha trevligt ihop när vi jobbar!
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker en engagerad och rutinerad Systemingenjör !
   

  

 För att trivas i konsultroll ser vi att du har en förmåga att driva arbete framåt, ta initiativ och ha engagemang och samarbetsförmåga. Du har teknisk akademisk utbildning lägst högskoleingenjör och/alternativt civilingenjör.
   

  

 Du har expertis inom Systems Engineering och projektledning. Du är väl förtrogen med systemarbete, kravhantering och har erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa tekniska system genom hela dess livscykel. Krav i rollen är flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet med metoder som ILS (Integrated Logistics Support) och livscykelmodellen ISO 15288. Du har arbetslivserfarenhet från försvar och/eller försvarsnära områden.
   

  

 Certifiering inom Systems Engineering (INCOSE) är meriterande.
   

  

 Vi vill också hitta dig som kan ta mer ledaransvar och agera System Engineer Manager. Du är en naturlig ledare med en genuin vilja att leda och inspirera dina kollegor, särskilt i tillfälligt, sammansatta grupper. Du trivs med att arbeta mot tydliga mål och är både affärsmässig och resultatinriktad i ditt arbetssätt. Ditt engagemang och din förmåga att entusiasmera andra gör att du är en viktig drivkraft för teamets framgång.
   

  

 Eftersom våra kunduppdrag kräver kommunikation på både svenska och engelska, är det viktigt att du känner dig bekväm i att uttrycka dig väl i både tal och skrift på dessa språk.
   

  

***Då tjänsten kan innebära arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.***
**Ytterligare information**
 Inom vår affärsenhet Defence & Security har vi flera olika kunskapsgrupper där vi har regelbundna träffar för kompetensutveckling, lära sig om andra projekt/uppdrag på AFRY eller bara umgås och har trevligt.
   

  

 Vi har också ett internt kursprogram för att stötta våra medarbetare som ska jobba mot försvarsindustrin och mot våra försvarsmyndigheter.
   

  

 För att kunna jobba i helhetsåtaganden till kund har vi en genomgående strategi att arbeta fokuserat på kompetensutveckling för våra konsulter. Det görs genom kompetensprojekt, seminarier och utbildningar inom olika områden. Allt skräddarsytt för dig som konsult.
   

  

 Eftersom våra kunder främst verkar i en försvarskontext är det en naturlig del i vår vardag att vi jobbar utifrån standarden ISO/IEC 15288.
   

  

 Något av det vi kan erbjuda dig:
   

  

* En trygg anställning med fast lön och kollektivtal – komponenter som är en självklarhet för oss!
* Årligt friskvårdbidrag om 4500 SEK/år, företagshälsovård, tjänstepension med personlig rådgivning, föräldraledighet reglerade i vårt kollektivavtal m. m.
* Företagsrabatter med externa partners genom vår förmånsportal: Benify, Advantage You.
* Club AFRY – Vår personalklubb med möjlighet till kultur- och sportevenemang, bokklubb, stuguthyrning, yoga m.m.
* En flexibel arbetsmiljö och stor frihet under ansvar då vi förstår att allas liv ser olika ut och vikten av att ha en god balans mellan jobb och fritid.
* Ett enormt nätverk av tekniska experter
* + 19 000 kollegor med kontor i 50 länder


 Kontaktpersoner för eventuella frågor:
   

  

 Stefan Oscarsson, Market Area Manager Land & Logistics
   

  

 stefan.oscarsson@afry.com
   

  

 Ellinor Danielsson, Rekryteringspartner
   

  

 ellinor.danielsson@afry.com
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag 12 mars 2025. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Technical Account Manager, EMEA
description:
**Description**
 At Amazon, our vision is to be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. Millions of businesses are using AWS cloud solutions to build sophisticated applications with increased flexibility, scalability and reliability.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 An AWS Technical Account Manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our Enterprise Support customers. As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. This includes a range of products including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT and many more.
   

  

 Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in EMEA. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
   

  

 This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
   

  

 As we continue to rapidly expand in EMEA, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills. You’ll work with talented cloud technologists whilst expanding your knowledge of AWS products. You’ll also have the chance to receive mentor-ship and gain AWS certifications.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? We would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Culture
   

  

 We’re passionate about supporting the needs of our people and their family members. Benefits include Healthcare, Employee Assistance Programs and Global Mobility opportunities.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.


 A day in the life
   

  

**See What The Team Say About Their Roles**
 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-liga-sr-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-balint-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-shlomo-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for a combination of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
* Customer obsessed


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP a plus but not a requirement
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, DevOps Engineer etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools including Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef is a plus


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2911524

title: Utveckla säkra applikationer för samhällsbärande projekt
description:
Vill du vara med och skydda våra kunders produkter mot cyberhot? Hos HiQ växer vår satsning på produktcybersäkerhet och vi behöver fler talangfulla utvecklare som delar vår passion för säkerhet. Vi erbjuder spännande uppdrag som garanterar personlig utveckling och där din insats verkligen gör skillnad – både för företag i privat sektor och för samhällskritiska verksamheter som vi stöttar sedan länge.
   

  

 HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher. Som konsult hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med ett brett utbud av spännande uppdrag hos välkända företag. Just nu söker vi Secure Web Application Developers med starkt intresse och kompetens inom backend-utveckling.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som checkar av några följande:**
* Erfarenhet av server-side programmering i språk som Java, Python, Node.js eller liknande.
* God kunskap om ramverk som Django, Spring Boot, Express.js, Ruby on Rails eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av databaser som Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra eller liknande.
